text: Flaviviridae is a family of viruses that are primarily spread through arthropod vectors (mainly ticks and mosquitoes). The family gets its name from Yellow Fever virus, a type virus of Flaviviridae; flavus means "yellow" in Latin. They include the following genera: * Genus Flavivirus (type species Yellow fever virus, others include West Nile virus and Dengue fever) * Genus Hepacivirus * Genus Pestivirus category:Viruses
title: Flaviviridae
